de.holisticon.annotationprocessortoolkit.validators

Class AbstractFluentValidator<T extends AbstractFluentValidator,E extends Element>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.holisticon.annotationprocessortoolkit.validators.AbstractFluentValidator<T,E>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractFluentElementValidator

    public abstract class AbstractFluentValidator<T extends AbstractFluentValidator,E extends Element>
extends Object
    Abstract validator.

    Configuration methods like info or error don't produce immutable instances!

      • mandatoryWarning

        public T mandatoryWarning()
        Sets the log level for all following validations to Diagnostic.Kind.NOTE.

        "Problem similar to a warning, but is mandated by the tool's specification. For example, the Java™ Language Specification mandates warnings on certain unchecked operations and the use of deprecated methods."

        Returns:
        this instance

      • other

        public T other()
        Sets the log level for all following validations to Diagnostic.Kind.NOTE.

        "Diagnostic which does not fit within the other kinds."

        Returns:
        this instance

        protected boolean isErrorLevel()
        Checks if error level is set. Useful to determine if validation affects validation result.
        Returns:

      • setCustomMessage

        public T setCustomMessage(String customMessageParam,
                          Object... customMessageParameterParam)
        Sets a custom message with parameters. It's possible to use placeholders for message parameters in the custom message string. Placeholders have the following format '${<index>}' like '${1}' for second parameter. The index is starting with 0.
        Parameters:
        customMessageParam - the custom message string
        customMessageParameterParam - the custom message parameters

      • setCustomMessage

        public T setCustomMessage(Diagnostic.Kind messageLevelParam,
                          String customMessageParam,
                          Object... customMessageParameterParam)
        Sets a custom message with parameters with passe message level. It's possible to use placeholders for message parameters in the custom message string. Placeholders have the following format '${<index>}' like '${1}' for second parameter. The index is starting with 0. Keep in mind that the passed message level only affects the next validation. If you want to change the message level for all following validation, choose dedicated message level setter methods instead.
        Parameters:
        messageLevelParam - the message level to use with for the next validation
        customMessageParam - the custom message string
        customMessageParameterParam - the custom message parameters

      • getCustomOrDefaultMessage

        protected String getCustomOrDefaultMessage(String defaultMessage,
                                           Object... defaultMessageParameters)

      • getValidationResult

        public boolean getValidationResult()
        Gets the validation result.
        Returns:
        true if the element was proved valid during all validations, otherwise false
